title: Why is my Legacy Client Not Working, Riot?
body: kind of annoying how I open up the launcher and click on legacy client, because I don't want to play on the Alpha client, and it doesn't open up, doesn't give me any sort of notification, or anything. Mind helping me out?

replies.body:
Here is what I did to fix this,

Right click on your Launcher, select properties, go to previous versions, and select the latest version of the legacy client you have. Then press restore.
The old Launcher should appear on your desktop, and you might have to delete the beta launcher icon if you want to. If the old launcher still does not work, then try running it as admin. I did it and it worked. I hope it works for you.
And when I log into the Alpha Client, my PLAY button in the corner, the client is scanning, what appears to be every file in the game, why?

That would be a background update. I'd recommend letting that run if you've already got it up and running. In order to get your legacy client working again, I'd recommend launching League from the **lol.launcher.admin.exe** file as admin (right-click, *run as administrator*) to ensure League has the right operating permissions.

If you see further issues after taking those steps, let me know.

Tried to launch legacy client after playing a game and it seemed to update the legacy client of all things and now it doesn't work.
Some people actually like to use item sets riot, fix your damn game.
